info.name: FleetDM Full API Collection v4.70.0
info.description: Comprehensive Postman collection for FleetDM v4.70.0, grouped by API documentation sections. Each endpoint is included with example requests, variables, and descriptions.

item.name: Authentication
item.description: Endpoints for user authentication, password management, and SSO.

item.name: Login

response.name: Default response (200)
response.body:
{
  "user": {
    "created_at": "2020-11-13T22:57:12Z",
    "updated_at": "2020-11-13T22:57:12Z",
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Jane Doe",
    "email": "[email protected]",
    "enabled": true,
    "force_password_reset": false,
    "gravatar_url": "",
    "sso_enabled": false,
    "mfa_enabled": false,
    "global_role": "admin",
    "teams": []
  },
  "token": "{your token}"
}

response.name: MFA Required (202)
Too many requests (429)

item.description:
Authenticate and retrieve an API token.

**Parameters:**
- email (string, required): The user's email.
- password (string, required): The user's plain text password.

item.name: Log out
item.description: Log out the authenticated user.

item.name: Forgot password
item.description: Send a password reset email.

item.name: Change password
item.description: Change the password for the authenticated user.

item.name: Reset password
item.description: Reset a user's password using a reset token.

item.name: Me
item.description: Get the authenticated user's information.

item.name: Perform required password reset
item.description: Reset the password of the authenticated user when required.

item.name: SSO config
item.description: Get the current SSO configuration.

item.name: Initiate SSO
item.description: Initiate SSO login.

item.name: SSO callback
item.description: SSO callback endpoint for identity provider assertions.

item.name: Activities
item.description: Endpoints for retrieving Fleet activity logs (audit logs).

item.name: List activities

query.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
Results per page.
What to order results by. Can be any column in the activities table.
The direction of the order given the order key. Options: 'asc', 'desc'. Requires order_key.

response.name: Default response (200)
response.body:

item.description:
Returns a list of activities (audit logs) performed in Fleet.

**Parameters:**
- page (integer, optional): Page number of the results to fetch.
- per_page (integer, optional): Results per page.
- order_key (string, optional): What to order results by.
- order_direction (string, optional): The direction of the order given the order key. Options: 'asc', 'desc'. Requires order_key.

item.name: File carving
item.description: Endpoints for osquery file carving operations.

item.name: List carves

query.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
Results per page.
What to order results by. Can be any field listed in the results array.

The direction of the order given the order key.
Valid options: 'asc', 'desc'. Requires order_key.
The value to get results after. Needs order_key defined.
Include expired carves (default: false)

response.name: Default response (200)
response.body:

  "carves": [

item.description:
Retrieve a list of non-expired carves.

**Parameters:**
- page (integer, optional): Page number of the results to fetch.
- per_page (integer, optional): Results per page.
- order_key (string, optional): What to order results by.
- order_direction (string, optional): The direction of the order given the order key.
- after (string, optional): The value to get results after.
- expired (boolean, optional): Include expired carves (default: false).

item.name: Get carve
item.description:
Retrieve details for a specific carve by ID.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, required): The desired carve's ID.

item.name: Get carve block
item.description:
Retrieve a specific block of a carve by carve ID and block ID.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, required): The desired carve's ID.
- block_id (integer, required): The desired carve block's ID.

item.name: Fleet configuration
item.description: Endpoints for retrieving and modifying Fleet server configuration, enroll secrets, and version info.

item.name: Get certificate
item.description: Returns the Fleet certificate.

item.name: Get configuration

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description: Returns all information about the Fleet's configuration. The agent_options, smtp_settings and sso_settings fields are only returned for admin and GitOps users with global access.

item.name: Modify configuration

query.description: Whether to force-apply the agent options even if there are validation errors.
Whether to validate the configuration and return any validation errors without applying changes.

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description: Modifies the Fleet's configuration with the supplied information. Supports force and dry_run query parameters for validation control.

item.name: Get global enroll secrets
item.description: Returns the valid global enroll secrets.

item.name: Modify global enroll secrets
item.description: Replaces all existing global enroll secrets.

item.name: Get team enroll secrets
item.description: Returns the valid team enroll secrets.

item.name: Modify team enroll secrets
item.description: Replaces all existing team enroll secrets.

item.name: Version
item.description: Get version and build information from the Fleet server.

item.name: Get configuration profiles assigned to a host
item.description:
Requires Fleet's MDM properly enabled and configured. Retrieves a list of the configuration profiles assigned to a host.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The ID of the host

item.name: Hosts
item.description: Endpoints for listing, retrieving, and managing hosts in Fleet. Hosts have various timestamps with '_at' suffix (created_at, updated_at, detail_updated_at, label_updated_at, last_enrolled_at, policy_updated_at, seen_time, software_updated_at, last_restarted_at) that track different aspects of host data.

item.name: List hosts

query.description: Page number of the results to fetch
Results per page
What to order results by. Can be any column in the hosts table
Direction of the order given the order key. Options: asc, desc. Default: asc
Status of hosts to return: new, online, offline, mia, missing
Search query keywords. Searchable fields: hostname, hardware_serial, uuid, ipv4, email addresses
Comma-delimited list of fields to include in each host's additional object
Fleet Premium: Filter to only include hosts in the specified team. Use 0 for 'No team'
ID of the policy to filter hosts by
Requires policy_id. Valid options: passing, failing
ID of the software version to filter hosts by
ID of the software title to filter hosts by
Status of software install: pending_install, failed_install, installed, pending_uninstall, failed_uninstall, pending, failed
ID of the operating system version to filter hosts by
Name of the operating system to filter hosts by. Requires os_version
Version of the operating system to filter hosts by. Requires os_name
CVE to filter hosts by (including 'cve-' prefix, case-insensitive)
Include device_mapping for each host
ID of the mobile device management solution to filter hosts by
Name of the mobile device management solution to filter hosts by
MDM enrollment status: manual, automatic, enrolled, pending, unenrolled
Filter hosts talking to this Fleet server for MDM features
Filter by MDM profile status: verified, verifying, pending, failed
ID of the munki issue to filter hosts by
Fleet Premium: Filter hosts with less GB of disk space available than this value (1-100)
If true, hosts return failing policies as 0 regardless of failures
Filter by disk encryption status: verified, verifying, action_required, enforcing, failed, removing_enforcement
Fleet Premium: Filter by MDM bootstrap package status: installed, pending, failed
Filter by OS settings status: verified, verifying, pending, failed
Filter by disk encryption status: verified, verifying, action_required, enforcing, failed, removing_enforcement
Include software details: false, without_vulnerability_details, true
Include policy data for each host
Include user data for each host
Include labels for each host
Requires profile_status. UUID of the profile to download
Requires profile_uuid. Valid options: verified, verifying, pending, failed

response.name: Default response (200)
response.body:

  "hosts": [

item.description: List all hosts with comprehensive filtering and pagination options. Supports filtering by status, query, team, policy, software, OS, vulnerabilities, MDM, and more. Use populate_* parameters to include additional data like software, policies, users, and labels.

item.name: Count hosts

query.description: What to order results by. Can be any column in the hosts table
Requires order_key. Direction of the order: asc, desc. Default: asc
Value to get results after. Requires order_key
Status of hosts to return: new, online, offline, mia, missing
Search query keywords. Searchable fields: hostname, hardware_serial, uuid, ipv4, email addresses
Fleet Premium: Filter to only include hosts in the specified team
ID of the policy to filter hosts by
Requires policy_id. Valid options: passing, failing
ID of the software version to filter hosts by
ID of the software title to filter hosts by
ID of the operating system version to filter hosts by
Name of the operating system to filter hosts by. Requires os_version
Version of the operating system to filter hosts by. Requires os_name
CVE to filter hosts by (including 'cve-' prefix, case-insensitive)
Valid label ID. Can only be used with order_key, order_direction, after, status, query, and team_id
ID of the mobile device management solution to filter hosts by
Name of the mobile device management solution to filter hosts by
MDM enrollment status: manual, automatic, enrolled, pending, unenrolled
Filter by MDM profile status: verified, verifying, pending, failed
ID of the munki issue to filter hosts by
Fleet Premium: Filter hosts with less GB of disk space available than this value (1-100)
Filter by disk encryption status: verified, verifying, action_required, enforcing, failed, removing_enforcement
Fleet Premium: Filter by MDM bootstrap package status: installed, pending, failed
Filter by OS settings status: verified, verifying, pending, failed
Filter by disk encryption status: verified, verifying, action_required, enforcing, failed, removing_enforcement

item.description: Get the total count of hosts with the same filtering options as the List hosts endpoint. Supports filtering by status, query, team, policy, software, OS, vulnerabilities, MDM, and more.

item.name: Get hosts summary

query.description: Fleet Premium: ID of the team whose host counts should be included. Defaults to all teams
Platform to filter by when counting. Defaults to all platforms
Fleet Premium: Returns count of hosts with less GB of disk space available than this value (1-100)

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description: Returns the count of all hosts organized by status. online_count includes all hosts currently enrolled in Fleet. offline_count includes all hosts that haven't checked into Fleet recently. mia_count includes all hosts that haven't been seen by Fleet in more than 30 days. new_count includes the hosts that have been enrolled to Fleet in the last 24 hours.

item.name: Get host

query.description: If true, the response will not include a list of installed software for the host
If true, will omit Fleet-maintained policies from the policies list

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description: Returns a subset of information about the host specified by token. This is the API route used by the My device page in Fleet desktop to display information about the host to the end user. To get all information about a host, use the Get host endpoint.

item.name: Delete host
item.description: Delete a host by ID.

item.name: Refetch host
item.description: Refetch a host's details from the agent.

item.name: Transfer hosts to a team
item.description: Transfer hosts to a team by host IDs.

item.name: Transfer hosts to a team by filter
item.description: Transfer hosts to a team by filter.

item.name: Turn off MDM for a host
item.description:
Turns off MDM for the specified macOS, iOS, or iPadOS host.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The host's ID in Fleet.

item.name: Batch-delete hosts by filter or ids
item.description:
Batch-delete hosts by IDs or by filter. The request body can include either 'ids' (an array of host IDs) or 'filters' (an object specifying filter criteria). Only one of 'ids' or 'filters' may be included in the request.

**Parameters:**
- ids (array, body): A list of the host IDs you'd like to delete. Required if filters not specified.
- filters (object, body): Required if ids not specified. See filters table in docs.

**Accepted filters:**
- query (string): Search query keywords. Searchable fields include hostname, hardware_serial, uuid, and ipv4.
- status (string): Host status. Can either be new, online, offline, mia or missing.
- label_id (number): ID of a label to filter by.
- team_id (number): ID of the team to filter by.

**Notes:** label_id and status filters cannot be used at the same time.

item.name: Update custom human-device mapping
item.description:
Updates the email for the custom data source in the human-device mapping. This source can only have one email.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The host's id.
- email (string, body, required): The custom email.

item.name: Get host's device health report

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description:
Retrieves information about a single host's device health. This report includes a subset of host vitals, and simplified policy and vulnerable software information. Data is cached to preserve performance.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The host's id.

item.name: Get host's mobile device management (MDM) information
item.description:
Currently supports Windows and MacOS. On MacOS this requires the macadmins osquery extension which comes bundled in Fleet's agent (fleetd). Retrieves a host's MDM enrollment status and MDM server URL. If the host exists but is not enrolled to an MDM server, then this API returns null.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The id of the host to get the details for

item.name: Get mobile device management (MDM) summary

query.description: Available in Fleet Premium. Filter by team
Filter by platform ("windows" or "darwin")

item.description:
Currently supports Windows and MacOS. On MacOS this requires the macadmins osquery extension which comes bundled in Fleet's agent (fleetd). Retrieves MDM enrollment summary. Windows servers are excluded from the aggregated data.

**Parameters:**
- team_id (integer, query): Available in Fleet Premium. Filter by team
- platform (string, query): Filter by platform ("windows" or "darwin")

A team_id of 0 returns the statistics for hosts that are not part of any team. A null or missing team_id returns statistics for all hosts regardless of the team.

item.name: Get host's mobile device management (MDM) and Munki information

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description:
Retrieves a host's MDM enrollment status, MDM server URL, and Munki version.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The id of the host to get the details for

item.name: Get aggregated host's mobile device management (MDM) and Munki information

query.description: Available in Fleet Premium. Filters the aggregate host information to only include hosts in the specified team.

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description:
Requires the macadmins osquery extension which comes bundled in Fleet's agent (fleetd). Currently supported only on macOS. Retrieves aggregated host's MDM enrollment status and Munki versions.

**Parameters:**
- team_id (integer, query): Available in Fleet Premium. Filters the aggregate host information to only include hosts in the specified team.

A team_id of 0 returns the statistics for hosts that are not part of any team. A null or missing team_id returns statistics for all hosts regardless of the team.

item.name: Resend host's configuration profile
item.description: Resend host's configuration profile.

item.name: Get host's software

query.description: Search query keywords. Searchable fields include name.
If true or 1, only list software that is available for install (added by the user). Default is false.
If true or 1, only lists self-service software. Default is false.
If true or 1, only list software that have vulnerabilities. Default is false.
Page number of the results to fetch.
Results per page.
What to order results by. Options include "name". Default is "name".
Requires order_key. The direction of the order given the order key. Options include "asc" and "desc". Default is "asc".
Available in Fleet Premium. Filters to include only software with vulnerabilities that have a CVSS version 3.x base score higher than the specified value.
Available in Fleet Premium. Filters to only include software with vulnerabilities that have a CVSS version 3.x base score lower than what's specified.
Available in Fleet Premium. If true, filters to only include software with vulnerabilities that have been actively exploited in the wild (cisa_known_exploit: true). Default is false.

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description:
Experimental feature. This feature is undergoing rapid improvement, which may result in breaking changes to the API or configuration surface. It is not recommended for use in automated workflows.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The host's ID.
- query (string, query): Search query keywords. Searchable fields include name.
- available_for_install (boolean, query): If true or 1, only list software that is available for install (added by the user). Default is false.
- self_service (boolean, query): If true or 1, only lists self-service software. Default is false.
- vulnerable (boolean, query): If true or 1, only list software that have vulnerabilities. Default is false.
- page (integer, query): Page number of the results to fetch.
- per_page (integer, query): Results per page.
- order_key (string, query): What to order results by. Options include "name". Default is "name".
- order_direction (string, query): Requires order_key. The direction of the order given the order key. Options include "asc" and "desc". Default is "asc".
- min_cvss_score (integer, query): Available in Fleet Premium. Filters to include only software with vulnerabilities that have a CVSS version 3.x base score higher than the specified value.
- max_cvss_score (integer, query): Available in Fleet Premium. Filters to only include software with vulnerabilities that have a CVSS version 3.x base score lower than what's specified.
- exploit (boolean, query): Available in Fleet Premium. If true, filters to only include software with vulnerabilities that have been actively exploited in the wild (cisa_known_exploit: true). Default is false.

item.name: Get hosts report in CSV
item.description: Get hosts report in CSV.

item.name: Get host's disk encryption key
item.description:
Retrieves the disk encryption key for a host. The host will only return a key if its disk encryption status is "Verified." Get hosts' disk encryption statuses using the List hosts endpoint and os_settings_disk_encryption parameter.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The id of the host to get the disk encryption key for.

item.name: Get host's certificates
item.description: Get a host's certificates.

item.name: Lock host

query.description: For macOS hosts, whether to return the unlock PIN.

item.description:
Available in Fleet Premium. Sends a command to lock the specified macOS, Linux, or Windows host. The host is locked once it comes online. To lock a macOS host, the host must have MDM turned on. To lock a Windows or Linux host, the host must have scripts enabled.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): ID of the host to be locked.
- view_pin (boolean, query): For macOS hosts, whether to return the unlock PIN.

To verify the host successfully locked, you can use the Get host endpoint to retrieve the host's mdm.device_status.

item.name: Unlock host
item.description:
Available in Fleet Premium. Sends a command to unlock the specified Windows or Linux host, or retrieves the unlock PIN for a macOS host. To unlock a Windows or Linux host, the host must have scripts enabled.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): ID of the host to be unlocked.

To verify the host successfully unlocked, you can use the Get host endpoint to retrieve the host's mdm.device_status. macOS hosts require entering unlock_pin to unlock.

item.name: Wipe host
item.description: Wipe a host.

item.name: Get host's past activity
item.description: Get a host's past activity.

item.name: Get host's upcoming activity
item.description: Get a host's upcoming activity.

item.name: Cancel host's upcoming activity
item.description: Cancel a host's upcoming activity.

item.name: Add labels to host
item.description:
Adds manual labels to a host.

**Parameters:**
- labels (array, body): The list of label names to add to the host.

**Request body example:**
```json
{
  "labels": ["label1", "label2"]
}
```

item.name: Remove labels from host
item.description:
Removes manual labels from a host.

**Parameters:**
- labels (array, body): The list of label names to delete from the host.

**Request body example:**
```json
{
  "labels": ["label3", "label4"]
}
```

item.name: Live query one host (ad-hoc)

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description:
Runs an ad-hoc live query against the specified host and responds with the results. The live query will stop if the targeted host is offline, or if the query times out. Timeouts happen if the host hasn't responded after the configured FLEET_LIVE_QUERY_REST_PERIOD (default 25 seconds) or if the distributed_interval agent option (default 10 seconds) is higher than the FLEET_LIVE_QUERY_REST_PERIOD.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): The target host ID.
- query (string, body, required): The query SQL.

**Request body example:**
```json
{
  "query": "SELECT model, vendor FROM usb_devices;"
}
```

Note that if the host is online and the query times out, this endpoint will return an error and rows will be null. If the host is offline, no error will be returned, and rows will be null.

item.name: Live query host by identifier (ad-hoc)

response.name: Default response (200)

item.description:
Runs an ad-hoc live query against a host identified using uuid and responds with the results. The live query will stop if the targeted host is offline, or if the query times out. Timeouts happen if the host hasn't responded after the configured FLEET_LIVE_QUERY_REST_PERIOD (default 25 seconds) or if the distributed_interval agent option (default 10 seconds) is higher than the FLEET_LIVE_QUERY_REST_PERIOD.

**Parameters:**
- identifier (integer or string, path, required): The host's hardware_serial, uuid, osquery_host_id, hostname, or node_key.
- query (string, body, required): The query SQL.

**Request body example:**
```json
{
  "query": "SELECT model, vendor FROM usb_devices;"
}
```

Note that if the host is online and the query times out, this endpoint will return an error and rows will be null. If the host is offline, no error will be returned, and rows will be null.

item.name: Live query one host (ad-hoc)
item.description: Run a live query on a single host by host ID.

item.name: Wipe host
item.description:
Sends a command to wipe the specified macOS, iOS, iPadOS, Windows, or Linux host. The host is wiped once it comes online. To wipe a macOS, iOS, iPadOS, or Windows host, the host must have MDM turned on. To lock a Linux host, the host must have scripts enabled.

**Parameters:**
- id (integer, path, required): ID of the host to be wiped.
- windows (object, body): Optional metadata used when wiping Windows hosts. The object includes a wipe_type property that can be used for specifying what type of remote wipe to perform. Allowed values are "doWipe" and "doWipeProtected".

**Optional request body example:**
```json
{ "windows": { "wipe_type": "doWipe" } }
```

To verify the host was successfully wiped, you can use the Get host endpoint to retrieve the host's mdm.device_status.

item.name: Get host's past activity

query.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
Results per page.

response.name: Default response (200)

Get host's past activity.

**Parameters:**

- page (integer, query): Page number of the results to fetch.
- per_page (integer, query): Results per page.

item.name: Add custom OS setting (configuration profile)

formdata.description: Required. The .mobileconfig, JSON, or XML file containing the configuration profile.
Optional (Fleet Premium). Team ID to target. If specified, applies only to hosts in this team.
Optional (Fleet Premium). Array of label IDs. Only hosts with all these labels are targeted. Only one of labels_include_all, labels_include_any, or labels_exclude_any can be specified.
Optional (Fleet Premium). Array of label IDs. Hosts with any of these labels are targeted. Only one of labels_include_all, labels_include_any, or labels_exclude_any can be specified.
Optional (Fleet Premium). Array of label IDs. Hosts without any of these labels are targeted. Only one of labels_include_all, labels_include_any, or labels_exclude_any can be specified.

item.description: Add a configuration profile to enforce custom settings on macOS and Windows hosts. Accepts a .mobileconfig, JSON, or XML file. Optional parameters allow targeting by team or label (Fleet Premium). Only one of labels_include_all, labels_include_any, or labels_exclude_any can be specified.

item.name: List custom OS settings (configuration profiles)

query.description: (Fleet Premium) Team ID to filter profiles. If omitted, only 'No team' profiles are listed.
Page number of the results to fetch.
Results per page.

item.description: List all configuration profiles in Fleet. Supports filtering by team (Fleet Premium) and pagination with page and per_page query parameters.

item.name: Get or download custom OS setting (configuration profile)

query.description: If set to 'media', downloads the profile.

item.description: Get or download a custom OS setting (configuration profile) by UUID. Use 'alt=media' to download the profile.

item.name: Delete custom OS setting (configuration profile)
item.description: Delete a custom OS setting (configuration profile) by UUID.

item.name: Resend custom OS setting (configuration profile)
item.description: Resend a configuration profile to a host. Requires host ID and profile UUID.

item.name: Batch-resend custom OS setting (configuration profile)
item.description: Batch-resend configuration profiles. Body: profile_uuid (required), filters (object, required, e.g. {profile_status: 'failed'}).

item.name: Update disk encryption enforcement
item.description: Update disk encryption enforcement. Body: team_id (optional), enable_disk_encryption (boolean).

item.name: Get disk encryption statistics

query.description: (Fleet Premium) The team ID to filter the summary.

item.description: Get disk encryption statistics. Optional query: team_id.

item.name: Get OS settings summary

query.description: (Fleet Premium) The team ID to filter profiles.

item.description: Get OS settings summary. Optional query: team_id.

item.name: Get OS setting (configuration profile) status
item.description: Get status counts of a single OS settings (configuration profile) enforced on hosts. Path: profile_uuid (required).

item.name: Setup experience
item.description: Endpoints for managing MDM setup, bootstrap packages, EULA, and setup automation.

item.name: Set custom MDM setup enrollment profile
item.description: Set a custom MDM setup enrollment profile for a team or no team. Body: team_id (optional), name (optional), enrollment_profile (required, object).

item.name: Get custom MDM setup enrollment profile

query.description: Team ID to return the profile for.

item.description: Get the custom MDM setup enrollment profile for a team or no team. Optional query: team_id.

item.name: Delete custom MDM setup enrollment profile

query.description: Team ID to delete the profile for.

item.description: Delete the custom MDM setup enrollment profile for a team or no team. Optional query: team_id.

item.name: Get Over-the-Air (OTA) enrollment profile

query.description: Enroll secret of the team.

item.description: Get a signed OTA enrollment profile. Query: enroll_secret (required).

item.name: Get manual enrollment profile
item.description: Get an unsigned manual enrollment profile for macOS hosts.

item.name: Upload a bootstrap package

formdata.description: Optional. Team ID for the package.
Optional. If true, fleetd won't be installed.

item.description: Upload a bootstrap package for DEP setup. Form-data: package (file, required), team_id (optional), manual_agent_install (optional).

item.name: Get metadata about a bootstrap package

query.description: If true, for write action.

item.description: Get metadata about a bootstrap package. Path: team_id (required). Optional query: for_update.

item.name: Delete a bootstrap package
item.description: Delete a team's bootstrap package. Path: team_id (required).

item.name: Download a bootstrap package

query.description: Token of the bootstrap package.

item.description: Download a bootstrap package. Query: token (required).

item.name: Get a summary of bootstrap package status

query.description: Team ID to filter the summary.

item.description: Get a summary of bootstrap package status. Optional query: team_id.

item.name: Configure setup experience
item.description: Configure setup experience. Body: team_id, enable_end_user_authentication, enable_release_device_manually, manual_agent_install.

item.name: Upload an EULA file

formdata.description: Required. PDF document containing the EULA.

item.description: Upload an EULA file (PDF). Form-data: eula (file, required).

item.name: Get metadata about an EULA file
item.description: Get metadata about the uploaded EULA file.

item.name: Delete an EULA file
item.description: Delete an EULA file. Path: token (required).

item.name: Download an EULA file
item.description: Download an EULA file. Path: token (required).

item.name: List software (setup experience)

query.description: Team ID to filter software by.
Page number of the results to fetch.
Results per page.

item.description: List software for setup experience. Query: team_id, page, per_page.

item.name: Update software (setup experience)

query.description: Team ID to set the software for.

item.description: Update software for setup experience. Query: team_id (optional). Body: software_title_ids (array, required).

item.name: Add script (setup experience)

formdata.description: Team ID to add the script to (optional).
Script file to run during setup (required).

item.description: Add a script to run during setup experience. Form-data: team_id (optional), script (file, required).

item.name: Get or download script (setup experience)

query.description: Team ID to get the script for (optional).
If set to 'media', downloads the script.

item.description: Get or download a script for setup experience. Query: team_id (optional), alt (optional, set to 'media' to download).

item.name: Delete script (setup experience)

query.description: Team ID to delete the script for (optional).

item.description: Delete a script for setup experience. Query: team_id (optional).

item.name: Commands
item.description: Endpoints for running and retrieving results of MDM commands.

item.name: Run MDM command
item.description: Run a custom MDM command on targeted hosts. Body: command (Base64 string, required), host_uuids (array, required).

item.name: Get MDM command results

query.description: The unique identifier of the command.

item.description: Get results for a specific custom MDM command. Query: command_uuid (required).

item.name: List MDM commands

query.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
Results per page.
Field to order results by.
Order direction (asc or desc). Requires order_key.
Host's hostname, uuid, or hardware_serial.
Request type to filter commands by.

item.description: List custom MDM commands that have been executed. Query: page, per_page, order_key, order_direction, host_identifier, request_type.
